item.title: Upgrading from Congo 1.x
item.description: Although Congo 2.

item.title: Installation
item.description: Simply follow the standard Hugo Quick Start procedure to get up and running quickly.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: This section assumes you have already installed the Congo theme.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Congo is a highly customisable theme and uses some of the latest Hugo features to simplify how it is configured.

item.title: Icons
item.description: Congo has built-in support for a number of FontAwesome 6 icons.

item.title: Users
item.description: Real websites that are built with Congo.

item.title: Homepage Layout
item.description: Congo provides a fully flexible homepage layout.

item.title: Front Matter
item.description: In addition to the default Hugo front matter parameters, Congo adds a number of additional options to customise the presentation of individual articles.

item.title: Shortcodes
item.description: In addition to all the default Hugo shortcodes, Congo adds a few extras for additional functionality.

item.title: Partials
item.description: Analytics # Congo provides built-in support for Fathom Analytics and Google Analytics.

item.title: Content Examples
item.description: If you’ve been reading the documentation in order, you should now know about all the features and configurations available in Congo.

item.title: Advanced Customisation
item.description: There are many ways you can make advanced changes to Congo.

item.title: Hosting & Deployment
item.description: There are many ways to deploy your Hugo website built with Congo.

item.title: Markdown
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown formatting that can be used in Congo, also it shows how some basic HTML elements are decorated.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: This is an example of a rich content summary.

item.title: Mathematical notation
item.description: KaTeX can be used to render mathematical notation within articles.

item.title: Charts
item.description: Congo includes Chart.js for powerful charts and data visualisations.

item.title: Diagrams and Flowcharts
item.description: It’s easy to add diagrams and flowcharts to articles using Mermaid.
